content:
About Ogilvy
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry. 
About the Role  
Ogilvy seeks a highly driven Creative Project Manager to join the Creative Operations team working full time on a variety of creative projects within a fast-paced/fast-turnaround social media content studio, for one of our large food & beverage clients. As a Creative Project Manager, you will partner with Creative, Program Management, Client Services, Production, Strategy and Finance teams across all projects within the client portfolio that you will support. This role is dedicated to objectively managing the agency’s process from start to finish to ensure a best-in-class product is delivered to the client in the most efficient and effective way.
What You’ll Do 

Partner closely with all teams to be a facilitator of communication across all departments, ensuring that key updates / milestones / conversations are communicated clearly.
Be the day-to-day liaison between the creative team and the account supervisors who lead various client verticals
Manage and determine timelines and processes while making sure both are adhered to throughout the lifespan of a project.
Manage resources so that the right task to talent is assigned, and to make sure that all team members are supported in a way that allows them to focus on their core job responsibilities.
Clearly communicate creative project status, timelines, deliverables, goals, financial status and expectations to teams and clients on a regular basis
Contributes to the creative process by participating in the assessment of feasibility of proposed solutions
Consistently identifies and pursues opportunities for enhancing involvement and contributions to the account, team, and agency
Is fully familiar with client team’s communications plans for accounts; understands and tracks clients’ businesses
Understands the full range of resources and products available throughout the company
You will manage the execution of creative projects from brief to final delivery. The ideal candidate is passionate about solving our clients’ problems and will work closely with the creative team as well as all other disciplines to develop, budget, track and execute strategic and creative solutions.

What You’ll Need  

4+ years of creative project management experience demonstrating successful management of projects from kick-off to completion
Solid understanding of creative project process (e.g., development of digital and print materials, graphics, video, etc.)
Ability to multi-task and work cross-functionally with creative, strategy, client services, finance, and program management
Comfortable managing and tracking a large volume of projects at various stages with different teams, deliverables, and budgets
Exhibits highly effective communication skills. Uses different communication channels (phone, email, chat) appropriately and is equally effective with each channel.
Demonstrates effective interpersonal skills with peers, supervisors, and clients. Is sensitive to style differences among others and adjusts own style when working with different people.
Clearly demonstrates the ability to work in a dynamic environment through flexibility, resilience, and a positive outlook
Exhibits a sense of curiosity and a growth orientation. Continuously seeks out knowledge as well as growth and learning opportunities.
Seeks out and is receptive to feedback. Learns from and applies feedback by making suggested improvements and adjustments in work performance.
Is solutions-oriented, recommends solutions when problems arise, assists colleagues in problem solving, and seeks input from colleagues in problem resolution
Knows when to rely on one's own judgment and when to seek advice from supervisor and other team members
Agency experience required
Experience with Smartsheet / 10k Resource Management or other project management tools a plus

How We’ll Support You 
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.  


The base salary range for this position at the time of this posting is indicated below. Individual compensation varies based on job-related factors, including location, business needs, level of responsibility, experience, and qualifications. We offer a competitive benefits package, click here for more details.Pay Range$60,000—$140,000 USDAt Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
